bug.short_desc: AbstractField fix causes exceptions in Playground

long_desc.thetext:
The IE8 fix for the TextArea's auto-resizing feature introduced with commit 31f53f3 broke the 'Dialog' example in the Playground:
* Several TextFields are added to a Grid layout * core.Widget.__addHelper calls setLayoutParent on each field * this triggers the label's _applyFont method * _applyFont calls ui.core.queue.Manager.flush (the IE fix) * the Grid layout tries to render its children but setLayoutProperties hasn't been called yet, so an exception is thrown.
Correction: IE 8, 9 and 10 (but not 11 Preview) are all affected.

As a hotfix, I've reverted the change in AbstractField. This re-breaks the TextArea's autoResize feature in IE 8-10, so I've also disabled the affected unit tests for these clients (65f570f on master, 69f70e2).
We need to decide what to do with TextArea.autoResize. The code is a mess featuring no fewer than five browser-specific workarounds and it seems more like a coincidence that it ever worked in IE at all. Martin's and my gut feeling is that we should get rid of this feature entirely.
